pageContext.claim: “[Fentanyl] killing 88,000 people a year, and probably more. That's just the ones we know about.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump appears to have gotten his numbers mixed up. In total, just over 70,00 people died from drug overdoses in the U.S. in 2017. Of those, just over 28,400 were caused by "synthetic narcotics other than methadone mainly fentanyl." That's a little more than a quarter of the number of deaths Trump quoted.
